name: Frequently Asked Questions - Hyaluronic Acid Fillers

mainEntity.name: What is hyaluronic acid and what is it for?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Hyaluronic acid is a natural substance present in the skin that retains water and maintains hydration.
In aesthetics, it is used to fill wrinkles, restore volume, and improve facial and body structure safely and effectively.

mainEntity.name: What are the most commonly treated areas with hyaluronic acid?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The most common areas for applying hyaluronic acid are:

âœ… Cheekbones and jawline: Firming and facial contouring.
âœ… Hands: Hydration and rejuvenation.
âœ… Gluteus: Definition and volume increase.

mainEntity.name: How long does the effect of hyaluronic acid last?

acceptedAnswer.text: The duration depends on the treated area and the type of hyaluronic acid used. Generally, effects last between **6 and 18 months**, depending on the patient's metabolism and the injected product.

mainEntity.name: Can hyaluronic acid filler be reversed?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, if the patient is not satisfied with the results, hyaluronidase can be applied, an enzyme that dissolves hyaluronic acid safely and quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is the hyaluronic acid treatment painful?

acceptedAnswer.text: The procedure is well tolerated. Topical anesthesia is used to minimize discomfort, and microinjections are quick. Some areas may present mild swelling or redness, which disappear in a few hours.

mainEntity.name: What care should be taken after the treatment?

acceptedAnswer.text:
After the application of hyaluronic acid, it is recommended to:
âœ… Do not touch or massage the treated area.
âœ… Avoid direct sun exposure and intense heat (saunas, gyms) for 24-48 hours.
âœ… Do not consume alcohol or anticoagulants on the same day of the procedure.

mainEntity.name: How to choose the best type of hyaluronic acid for my skin?

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are different types of hyaluronic acid according to their density and cross-linking:
âœ… Light hyaluronic acid: Ideal for hydration and fine lines (lips, dark circles).
âœ… Medium density hyaluronic acid: For moderate wrinkles and folds.
âœ… Dense hyaluronic acid: Used in cheekbones, jawline, and gluteal volume increase.
A specialist evaluates each case and recommends the best option.
